page.title: 10 MYNYDD-ISA
page.content: Mynydd Isa is a large village, trebled in size over around twenty years to its present population of over 6000. Housing is varied, roads and pavements litter-free. In the square are a library,community and shopping centres.There are two pubs, the{Mercia and the{Griffin Inn.}There is one school, Watts Dyke Infants. We have a welsh chapel and St.Cecilia's,daughter church to St.Emmanuel's,Bistre. About 95% of the working population travel to work,many on buses which run as far as{Chester,Wrexham and {Birkenhead.}There are a few mixed farms in the locality.
